WorkItem.ClosedComment: Thanks for logging this issue. We've moved to a new codebase on GitHub; please try your issue against the new compiler and log an issue on the GitHub site if it still reproduces.
WorkItem.Description:
After installing the Typescript PowerTool for VS 2012 (see below), I get the following error "Output generation failed" when creating a new typescript file, adding valid typescript code, and saving it.  The .js file is never generated, and I only see the "...failed" error in the status bar. There are no other error details in any of my panes/windows.  I've configured the TypeScript text editor to compile on save, and have also installed the Web Essentials 2012 plugin, which shows me the preview screen, but currently on only shows "// Not compiled to disk yet."  I think that MSBuild does not have all of the information necessary to build the .JS files out, but I'm not positive.  I'm checking on a couple of work-arounds to manually add the configurations, but have only got it to work once, and i'm not sure what changes made it work.  

My install is VS Pro 2012 Update 4: And I used the link below for the power tool:
http://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/fa041d2d-5d77-494b-b0ba-8b4550792b4d

Thanks,

Comments.Message: Does this issue still occur when Web Essentials is not installed?
